oai_dc:dc.dc:title: U. S. picket pin
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This picket pin was used by calvarymen to tether a horse. It was found in either Lawrence or Giles counties in Tennessee. These were issued along with a 30 foot coil of rope. One end of the rope attached to the pin and the other to the horse's halter. The pin was then driven into the ground and the horse could graze in a thirty foot radius.
